text: tap. Loads of citrus and tropical fruits in the nose. resiny with a nice bitter finish. Excellent stuff.

On tap at The Brew Dock, Dublin. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, peach and lemon. Taste is moderate sweet with a nice fruity and crisp addition, lingering fruity citrus finish. Proper IPA in my world.
Keg in the Brew Dock, Dublin. Amber with a cream head. The taste is a great balance off malt and hops. Bitter pine with caramel. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Excellent.

Draft at the Black Sheep, Dublin with the family. Pours an Amber orange body with white lacing. Aroma is citrus fruits and faint tropical notes. Mouthfeel is medium and juicy with notes of bright citrus hop, fresh pine and clean malt bill. What is it that makes this a specialty grain and not an IPA?

Fucken speciality grain ... total bollocks of a style that detracts from my IPA count in general.
Keg at Brew Dock, Dublin, 28/06/15.
Lightly hazed golden amber with a decent light beige covering. 
Nose is orange pith, bubblegum,  caramel malt, juicy hop strokes, light bread, honeydew melon.
Taste comprises sweet citric jus, pine resin, light candy bar, pink grapefruit. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with juicy hop bitterness. 
Solid brew soured by being allocated to a shit 1 style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sample from tap at the Oslo bar, Galway. Very similar to the gbb voyager 2015. Hoppy with grapefruit, zest, pine, fruit. Smooth but a little old hops flavour. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

On tap at The Black Sheep, pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Nose is hugely fruity and quite hoppy, with tropical fruits upfront. Flavour is very hoppy and fruity as well, with tropical fruits, resinous hops, and just enough dry grainy malt to back. Massively fruity and hoppy. Nice IPA.
Birra dal colore ambrato pieno. Aroma erbaceo, di resina, frutta estiva, pesca. Birra piacevole, bilanciata. Corpo pieno. Il luppolo è in evidenza ma la birra rimane bilancaita. Ottima.
Pint in brew dock. Pours cloudy amber with thin white foam head. Aroma is spruce, pine, citrus nose. Flavour is sweet chewy caramel malt with bittering grapefruit finish.
Strong oatmeal flavour. Slightly cloudy appearance. Unusual but definitely a plus from me.

Keg at Against The Grain, Dublin. It pours a murky yellow/light brown/nutty color with a small tan head. Aroma is grainy, grassy, leafy, earthy, with notes of cereal, earth, pine cones. Taste is medium bitter and lightly sweet, with notes of bread, dried leaves, biscuit, grass, pine cones, cereals, lactose. Medium bodied with soft to good carbonation. Overall, weird, not sure I get the point of an oatmeal IPA
Aroma of hops and something else pleasant but which I cant identify. Nice golden colour.
Brew Dock in Dublin. Deep orange pour with a good head. Pineapple, oatmeal, lemon, pine. Quite full bodied and tangy on the palate. Very good.

oh God is that good...on draft, hazy gold in color, fluffy white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass. Pine, floral, citrus hop aroma floating up from even a few feet away. Taste is the same which is lovely, but the extra step here is the mouthfeel, remove the astringent medicinal quality that some IPAs have and insert a hop bomb that rests on a cloud for your tasting pleasure.
Poured hazy dark golden in colour. Aroma: pine, pineapple, citrus hops. tastes of grapefruit, lemon, quite citruss and bitter. Very hoppy ale. Dry finish. Very tasty

Offwhite lacing mango and citrus pith nose. Fairly sherbety, medium body and carbonation, pithy, dry finish.

Keg @ Black Sheep, Dublin [031214]
Light orange, hazy, thin white head, some lacing
Aroma of lots of tropical fruits, piney hops, orange, juicy fruits
Taste of citrus zest, juicy fruits, tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, grapefruit, bitter zest, nice sweet fruity pale malts background, really tasty
Palate - Soft carb, medium body, bit oily, smooth texture from the oatmeal, lots of bitter hops with a balanced sweet malt background. Finish has more bitter zest hop in the linger
Overall - Really good. Easy drinking for the abv. Cracking stuff. Hopefully this will be a regular...its one of their best

Draught at the brewpub. Hazy amber with a small white head. Aroma of fruity hops, peachy, some pine and grapefruit with some bready and biscuit malt. Sweet flavour, citrus fruits, apricot, peachy. Bitter finish, dry. The mouthfeel benefits from the oats. Very nice.

On tap at Brew Dock. Appearance : Orange, lots of carbonation. Medium white head. Aroma: bitter, pineapple, pine needles and lemon. Flavour: bitter, lovely mango and lemon flavour with spice, citrus peel, needles. Long sticky pine finish. Lovely.

Growler from Black Sheep, Dublin. 

Pale amber with taupe film. 3.75
Mango and Seville orange nose. 4
Apricot compote then more juicy orange and floral hops. 3.75
Porridgey finish and bitter linger. 
Near medium, creamy, round. 4

-- Oats in here? Fuller, but otherwise not much sign of them. Perfumed and oily (Cascade over Citra or Mosaic that way) more than oaty. Still nice, though. 3.75

Draught at Brewdock. Deep orange amber with a solid head, good lacing. Aroma is sugared grapefruit. Big juicy flavour, pineapple, mango, tropical fruits, on a robust but not intimidating bitterness. Really like oats in beer.

Draught at against the grain. Clear bronze colour, thin white head. Lovely passion fruit and pineapple, summer fruits nose, some zesty citrus. Flavour is a robust IPA, sweet malt and big hops, mute fruity notes. Loads of body, light carbonation.Long bitter finish.

Keg at ATG Dublin. Hazy light amber/orange, good bit of murk going on. Aroma is fab: incredibly fruit forward with tangerine, melon, mango, light lime and strawberry in there. Bit of spruce and slightly sweeter resin too. Taste gives all that juicy fruit, with orange, mango and strawberry giving it socks. Slightly sticky resinous note in there too, although quickly dries out with grapefruit and pine needles towards the finish. Solid doughy malt backbone, pretty full mouthfeel, nice biscuit character. Very solid balance, not overly bitter, but a really great flavour/aroma hop experience from start to finish. Never gets sticky, keeps on the right side of crisp. So good. As usual from these guys.
